sentence: Looking at options trading activity among components of the S&P 500 index, there is noteworthy activity today in Vertex Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (Symbol: VRTX), where a total volume of 8,192 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 819,200 underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares).
That number works out to 56.2% of VRTX's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 1.5 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $90 strike call option expiring March 17, 2017 , with 3,617 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 361,700 underlying shares of VRTX.

Below is a chart showing VRTX's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $90 strike highlighted in orange:

Gilead Sciences, Inc. (Symbol: GILD) options are showing a volume of 50,039 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 5.0 million underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 55.6% of GILD's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 9.0 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $70 strike call option expiring March 17, 2017 , with 3,893 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 389,300 underlying shares of GILD.

Below is a chart showing GILD's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $70 strike highlighted in orange:

And Home Depot Inc (Symbol: HD) options are showing a volume of 23,198 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 2.3 million underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 54.4% of HD's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 4.3 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $142 strike put option expiring April 07, 2017 , with 5,504 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 550,400 underlying shares of HD.

Below is a chart showing HD's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $142 strike highlighted in orange:
